title: How to Connect a Tablet to a Computer

steps.title: Connect the tablet to the computer with a USB cable.
steps.content: Connect the tablet to the computer with a USB cable. Use the charging cable that came with your tablet or one that’s compatible. A notification will appear on the tablet. [1] X Research source If your tablet came with drivers and/or software, install them before you continue. There is usually no need to install special drivers to connect an Android to Windows.

steps.title: Tap the notification on the tablet.
steps.content: Tap the notification on the tablet. A list of connection options will appear.

steps.title: Tap Media Device.
steps.content: Tap Media Device . This allows you to transfer files between your computer and tablet.

steps.title: Press ⊞ Win+E on the computer.
steps.content: Press ⊞ Win + E on the computer. This opens the File Explorer. [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click This PC.
steps.content: Click This PC . It's in the left column. A list of drives and devices connected to your computer should appear in the main panel.

steps.title: Double-click your tablet.
steps.content: Double-click your tablet. This displays the files on your tablet. You can now drag files to and from the tablet as you would any other drive.

steps.title: Install Android File Transfer on your Mac.
steps.content: Install Android File Transfer on your Mac. You’ll need this free application to be able to browse and access files on your Android from your Mac. Here’s how to get it: [3] X Research source Go to https://www.android.com/filetransfer in a web browser. Click DOWNLOAD NOW to download the file. Open androidfiletransfer.dmg (the file you just downloaded). Drag Android File Transfer to the Applications folder. Follow the on-screen instructions to complete the installation.

steps.title: Connect the tablet to the computer with a USB cable.
steps.content: Connect the tablet to the computer with a USB cable. Use the charging cable that came with your tablet or one that’s compatible.

steps.title: Open Android File Transfer on your Mac.
steps.content: Open Android File Transfer on your Mac. It’s in the Applications folder.

steps.title: Tap the notification on the tablet.
steps.content: Tap the notification on the tablet. A list of connection options will appear.

steps.title: Tap Media Device.
steps.content: Tap Media Device . This allows you to transfer files between your computer and tablet.

steps.title: Install SHAREit on your PC or Mac.
steps.content: Install SHAREit on your PC or Mac. This is a free app that lets you connect your Android to any computer over a Wi-Fi connection. Here’s how: [4] X Research source Go to https://www.ushareit.com/ in a web browser. Click the download link for your operating system to download the app. Double-click the file you downloaded ( uShareIt_official.dmg for Mac, or SHAREit-KCWEB.exe for Windows). Follow the on-screen instructions to install the application.

steps.title: Open the Play Store on your tablet.
steps.content: Open the Play Store on your tablet. You’ll usually find it in the app drawer.

steps.title: Type shareit into the search bar.
steps.content: Type shareit into the search bar. A list of results will appear.

steps.title: Tap SHAREit – Transfer & Share.
steps.content: Tap SHAREit – Transfer & Share . It’s the app with the blue icon containing 3 dots and curved lines.

steps.title: Tap Install.
steps.content: Tap Install . This installs the application on your Android.

steps.title: Open SHAREit on your computer.
steps.content: Open SHAREit on your computer. It’s in the All Apps area of the Start menu in Windows, and in the Applications folder in macOS.

steps.title: Open SHAREit on your tablet.
steps.content: Open SHAREit on your tablet. It’s the blue and white icon (the same one from the Play Store) in the app drawer.

steps.title: Tap Receive on the tablet.
steps.content: Tap Receive on the tablet. It’s at the top of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Connect PC on the Android.
steps.content: Tap Connect PC on the Android. You can now use SHAREit on your computer to browse files on the tablet.

steps.title: Install iTunes.
steps.content: Install iTunes. If you’re using a Mac, you already have iTunes installed. If you’re using Windows and haven’t yet installed iTunes, you can get it for free from https://www.apple.com/itunes/ . For help installing iTunes, see Install iTunes. To connect an iPad to a Windows computer, download iTunes from apple. com. Then use your sync cable to connect your iPad to your Windows computer.

steps.title: Connect the iPad to the computer using the USB cable.
steps.content: Connect the iPad to the computer using the USB cable. Use the cable that came with your iPad or one that’s compatible. This action should launch iTunes automatically, and a pop-up message should appear on the iPad. If iTunes does not start automatically, click the music note icon in the Dock (macOS) or click iTunes in the All Apps area of the Start menu (Windows).

steps.title: Tap Trust on the iPad.
steps.content: Tap Trust on the iPad. This allows your iPad to communicate with the computer. You may also have to click Continue on your computer.

steps.title: Click the iPad button in iTunes.
steps.content: Click the iPad button in iTunes. It’s a small icon that looks like an iPhone or iPad. It’s close to the top-left corner of iTunes. Your iPad is now connected to your computer.

steps.title: Turn on Bluetooth on your iPad.
steps.content: Turn on Bluetooth on your iPad. This method will only work if you’re using a Mac. Open your iPad’s Settings . Tap Bluetooth . Slide switch to .

steps.title: Click the menu on your Mac.
steps.content: Click the menu on your Mac. It’s at the top-left corner of the screen.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences .

steps.title: Click Bluetooth.
steps.content: Click Bluetooth .

steps.title: Click Turn Bluetooth On.
steps.content: Click Turn Bluetooth On . It’s on the left side of the window. If you see “Turn Bluetooth Off” instead, Bluetooth is already on, and you should see the name of your iPad on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Click Pair next to your iPad’s name.
steps.content: Click Pair next to your iPad’s name. It’s on the right side of the window.

steps.title: Tap Pair on your iPad.
steps.content: Tap Pair on your iPad. This pairs the tablet to the computer. Your Mac may show a code that you must enter on your iPad to complete the pairing. If so, enter the code to pair.

steps.title: Click the in your Mac’s menu bar.
steps.content: Click the in your Mac’s menu bar. It’s at the top-right corner of the screen. If you don’t see the Bluetooth option, you’ll have to enable it. Click the menu, select System Preferences , click Bluetooth , then select Show Bluetooth in menu bar .

steps.title: Click Browse Files on Device….
steps.content: Click Browse Files on Device… . It’s at the bottom of the Bluetooth menu.

steps.title: Select your iPad and click Browse.
steps.content: Select your iPad and click Browse . You can now use your Mac to browse and utilize the files on your iPad.
